items.q: The ____ believed that the body and personality were regulated by four different humors . a. Ancient Romans b. Ancient Greeks c. Ancient Egyptians d. Ancient Chinese

According to Sheldon, the personality of an endomorph is ____. a. slow, sociable, and relaxed b. confident, energetic, and hot-tempered c. tense, fragile, and meticulous d. sociable, relaxed, and meticulous

The principles of the body split theory ____. a. do not include the backs and fronts of bodies b. include only the front of the body c. include both the front and the back of the body d. include only the back of the body
The ectomorph has a meticulous personality. The word meticulous means ____. a. not concerned about details b. very concerned about details c. has a relaxed manner d. requires a high activity level

Some researchers are upset with creating theories that connect appearance with character. They think this type of psychology creates ____. a. overly confident individuals b. low expectations for some people c. stereotyping of different groups d. poor academic success
In Sheldon's theory of personality types, an ectomorph moves with ____ movements. a. awkward b. energetic c. stooped d. hot-tempered
In Eysenck's theory of personality, the elements of personality are arranged in hierarchical order. Hierarchical means ____. a. numerical b. alphabetical c. from higher to lower d. random
According to Eysenck, extraverts ____. a. like to spend evenings at home alone b. are social and uninhibited c. prefer books to people d. do not make friends easily
Research has shown that Eysenk's theories of cortical arousal ____. a. do not appear to be true b. are probably true c. need more study d. both b and c
When Eysenk says that introverts are introspective, he means that they are ____. a. outgoing b. nervous c. thoughtful d. angry
Extraverts appear to be less likely than introverts to be aroused by subtle stimulation . In this sentence, the word subtle means ____. a. musical b. hardly noticeable c. very loud d. visual

When you classify something, you divide people, places, things or ideas into groups that ____. a. have dissimilar characteristics b. have similar characteristics c. have both similar and contrasting characteristics d. do not identify any similar or different characteristics
Many sociable people also tend to be ____. a. introspective b. retiring c. impulsive d. depressed
Eysenck believes there is ample evidence to support his theories. Ample means ____. a. not enough b. enough c. unimportant d. hidden
According to Eysenck, extraverted people like busy, noisy places because ____. a. They need stimulation. b. They feel depressed. c. They like loud people. d. It's better than TV.
An enterprising person _____. a. likes to win prizes b. has a lot of money c. is a hard worker d. understands psychology well
Which is not a part of a torso? a. chest b. stomach c. back d. legs
People who are mean are _____. a. unkind b. gentle c. easily pleased d. lazy
_____ invented the term ectomorph. a. Shakespeare b. The Greeks c. Sheldon d. Eysenck
According to Sheldon, a stiff back is not hiding _____. a. anger b. love c. stress d. fear
An impulsive person _____. a. acts without thinking b. is jealous c. has a stooped back d. doesn’t like other people
If you are aversive to something, you _____. a. are curious about it b. want to own it c. don’t understand it d. don’t like it

Eysenck says that _____. a. most people are extraverts b. most people fall somewhere between the extremes of introversion and extraversion c. introversion is a serious problem d. most people are introverts

Eysenck says that introverts and extraverts _____. a. have different biological makeups b. are basically the same c. have difficulty understanding each other d. have the same level of cortical stimulation
The best classifications are based on three or four different principles.
The thesis statement in a classification essay introduces the categories to be discussed.
When using words or phrases in a series, parallel structure uses the same grammatical form.
Transitions that introduce contrast like unlike , are not used in classification essays.
Connecting the way a person looks with personality characteristics is a modern development.
The theory of "body splits" maintains that each section of the body reveals something about a person's personality.
In the "body splits" theory, a stooped back indicates a hot temper.
Eysenck believes that a graceful spine indicates a strong and flexible personality. In this sentence, the word graceful means rigid.
Others words for uninhibited are free and open.
A dimension of a person's personality is an aspect of his character . The word dimension means element or part .
Hot-tempered people make life easy for others.
People stride with their legs.
If you do not stand up straight, you are stooped .
The Greeks believed that four humors determine each person’s personality type.
According to Sheldon, a person with thin legs and narrow hips may have trouble expressing him- or herself.
A retiring person enjoys meeting new people.
A stimulating conversation is an interesting one.
Introverts are more strongly aroused when exposed to loud music.
Eysenck said there were two basic supertraits of personality.
According to Sheldon, the front of the body is associated with the unconscious self.
Extraverts are bored by slow-moving movie plot, soft music, and
Eysenck did his research carefully, meticulously, and
Extraverts like to spend their time partying, dancing, or
Introverts are more strongly aroused by loud music, active social encounters, and
People can be classified by body language: movements, posture, and
Write a classification essay about types of sports.
